column3: A sink call is considered Tainted if its argument depends on msg.value or msg.sender or its execution depends on msg.value or msg.sender
Contracts that may receive ether must also allow users to extract the deposited ether from the contract.
Calls into external contracts that receive all remaining gas and are followed by state changes may be reentrant.
Ether transfers (such as send and transfer) that are followed by state changes may be reentrant.
Method arguments must be sanitized before they are used in computations.
Repeated call to an untrusted contract may result in different values
The amount of ether transferred must not be influenced by other transactions.
The receiver of ether transfers must not be influenced by other transactions.
Transaction Order Affects Execution of Ether Transfer
Ether transfers whose execution can be manipulated by other transactions must be inspected for unintended behavior.
The return value of statements that may return error values must be explicitly checked.
The execution of ether flows should be restricted to an authorized set of users.
Contract fields that can be modified by any user must be inspected.
Calls to selfdestruct that can be triggered by any user must be inspected.
Delegatecall or callcode to unrestricted address
The address of a delegatecall or callcode must be approved by the contract owner.
Information might be lost due to division before multiplication
State variables in inherited contract should not be named identically to inherited variables
Unused state variables should be removed.
State variables should be explicitly initialized.
If a single call in the loop fails or revers, it will cause all other calls to fail as well.
The return value of statements that may return error values must be explicitly checked.
Strict equalities that use account's balance, timestamps and block numbers should be avoided
The value returned by an external function call is never used
Returned value relies on block timestamp.
State variables that do not change should be declared as constants.
A public function that is never called within the contract should be marked as external
Reentrancy is equivalent with two consecutive calls of the function
